task.title: Configuring TLS in the security profile by using the
task.shortdesc: System administrators can disable and enable TLS in the security profile by using the Security Settings page in the .

prereq.p: If you need to enable TLS on an endpoint, you must create a certificate profile before you can create a security profile. The certificate profile defines the server certificate to use in the security profile. For more information about creating a certificate profile, see the Configuring certificate profiles topic in the Administering section of IBM Knowledge Center.

context.p: The security profile defines the TLS and authentication method that are applied to an endpoint. You can disable and enable TLS in the security profile by using the , or by using the command line. A Use TLS check box is provided in the IBM MessageSight Web UI for you to specify whether TLS is enabled. You can disable TLS by clearing the Use TLS check box.
For more information about using the command line to disable and enable TLS in the security profile , see .

step.cmd: Go to the Security Settings page in one of the following ways:

choices.choice: From the Home tab, click Security Settings in the Secure your appliance pane.
From the Appliance menu, click Security Settings.

step.cmd: Choose an action from the Security Profiles pane:

choices.choice: To add a security profile, click the Add icon and select or clear the Use TLS check box.
To edit a security profile, select the profile, click the Edit icon and select or clear the Use TLS check box.

postreq.p: Associate the security profile with an endpoint. For more information, see the Configuring message hubs topic in the Administering section of IBM Knowledge Center.
